ref: 8951 prāyas ʻ for the most part ʼ MBh. 2. prāyēṇa Mn. [Orig. a comparative conn. with purú -- (cf. Av. frāyō): later association with prāyá -- m. ʻ going forth ʼ RV., ʻ anything prominent ʼ ŚBr. produced prāyēṇa, prāyaśas EWA ii 377]
Pk. pāyaṁ ʻ for the most part ʼ,
N. po ʻ slightly adversative particle ʼ;
M. pã̄ ʻ expletive particle ʼ LM 363.
